sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"确信无疑"之意。
means: certainty ： 指在客观上和主观上都无一丝一毫的怀疑。
assurance ： 侧重依靠个人力量、本能、方法或对其他人或事的完全信任，强调有信心。
conviction ： 多指在理性基础上清除了原有的疑虑或无把握，着重对证据的主观反应。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"保证，担保"之意。
means: pledge ： 普通用词，指严肃地承诺、信守原则，常以个人名誉作为承诺的保证。
guarantee ： 一般指以口头的、协定或合同的形式作为保证、担保，强调口头承诺，含违背许诺，则予以补偿之意。
assurance ： 指用语言保证以消除人们思想上的怀疑与担心。

sentence.Network_en: The EU is now acquiring greater assurance and authority.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在欧共体越来越有自信与权威性了。

sentence.Network_en: They had given an absolute assurance that it would be kept secret.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们信誓旦旦地保证将对此绝对保密。

sentence.Network_en: Masur led the orchestra with assurance.
sentence.Network_cn: 马苏尔神定气若地指挥乐团。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in sense 2): from Old French, from assurer 'assure'

entry.def: If you give someone an assurance that something is true or will happen, you say that it is definitely true or will definitely happen, in order to make them feel less worried.

example.ex: He would like an assurance that other forces will not move into the territory that his forces vacate...
example.tran: 他想确保其他势力不会在他的军队撤离后进入这个地区。

example.ex: He will have been pleased by Marshal Yazov's assurance of the armed forces' loyalty.
example.tran: 当亚佐夫元帅向他保证武装部队的忠诚时，他会感到心满意足的。

entry.def: If you do something with assurance, you do it with a feeling of confidence and certainty.

example.ex: Masur led the orchestra with assurance...
example.tran: 马苏尔神定气若地指挥乐团。

example.ex: The EU is now acquiring greater assurance and authority.
example.tran: 现在欧共体越来越有自信与权威性了。

entry.def: Assurance is insurance that provides cover in the event of death.

means.word_mean: 1. freedom from doubt; belief in yourself and your abilities;

sentences.sentence: "his assurance in his superiority did not make him popular"
"after that failure he lost his confidence"

means.word_mean: 2. a binding commitment to do or give or refrain from something;

sentences.sentence: "signed a pledge never to reveal the secret"

means.word_mean: 3. a statement intended to inspire confidence;
4. a British term for some kinds of insurance

auth_sentence.content: The self-assurance he gives Zuckerberg is audacious and funny.
auth_sentence.res_content: The self-assurance he gives Zuckerberg is audacious and funny.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The self-assurance he gives Zuckerberg is audacious and funny.

auth_sentence.content: This tender assurance served only to exasperate Aunt Catherine.
auth_sentence.res_content: This tender assurance served only to exasperate Aunt Catherine.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This tender assurance served only to exasperate Aunt Catherine.

auth_sentence.res_content: Mark would not fumble...he would move with absolute assurance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mark would not fumble...he would move with absolute assurance.

stems_affixes.word_buile: assure[v.肯定;确保]+ed……的→adj.确实的, 确定的
sure肯定,确定→adj.确信的；确实的；一定的 adv.的确
assured[adj.确实的, 确定的]+ly表副词→adv.确实地;确信地
sure肯定,确定→adj.确信的；确实的；一定的 adv.的确
insure[v.保险,给…保险;保证]+ance表名词→n.保险,保险费,保险业

stems_affixes.value_cn: 保证,担保;确信,断言;信心,信念
stems_affixes.word_buile: assure[v.肯定;确保]+ance表名词→n.保证,担保;确信,断言;信心,信念

stems_affixes.value_cn: 保证人, 担保, 保证
stems_affixes.word_buile: sure肯定,确定+ty表名词→n.保证人, 担保, 保证
as一再+sure确定→一再确定→肯定

stems_affixes.value_cn: 保证, 担保, 使安全, 保证得到
stems_affixes.word_buile: en使……+sure[adj.确信的；确实的；一定的 adv.的确]→v.保证, 担保, 使安全, 保证得到 v.确保, 确保, 保证
in使……+sure肯定,确定→v.保险,给…保险;保证
re再次+assure确信→v.消除某人疑虑

means.word_mean: 保证, 担保, 确信

sentences.en: She gave repeated assurances of her loyalty.
The young teacher lacked assurance in front of his class.
sentences.cn: 这位青年教师在学生面前缺少自信心。
